life and marriage - Social stratification and groupings</topcClas>         <topcClas>Income, property and investment - Economics</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p><b>Safe Room Access FRS data</b><br> Safe Room access datasets for FRS data from 2005 are available in addition to the versions available under the standard End User Licence (EUL), held at the UK Data Archive under SN 7196, Family Resources Survey, 2005-2011 and Households Below Average Income, 1994-2011: Safe Room Access. These data replace SNs 5839, 6083, 6253 and 6532, which were previously available under Special Licence.<br> <br> The Safe Room access data are currently only available to UK HE/FE applicants  and for access from the UK Data Archive's Safe Room at the University of Essex, Colchester. Prospective users of the Safe Room access version of the FRS/HBAI will need to fulfil requirements additional to those associated with standard End User Licence datasets. Full details of the application requirements are available from <a href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/media/178323/secure_frs_application_guidance.pdf" title="Guidance on applying for the Family Resources Survey: Secure Access">Guidance on applying for the Family Resources Survey: Secure Access</a>.<br> <br> Further information about the FRS can be found on the <a href="http://research.dwp.gov.uk/asd/frs" title="Family Resources Survey">Family Resources Survey</a> pages on the Department for Work and Pensions web site.</abstract>       <abstract>The Family Resources Survey aims to: support the monitoring of the social security programme; support the costing and modelling of changes to national insurance contributions and social security benefits; provide better information for the forecasting of benefit expenditure.<br> For the fifth edition of the 1995-1996 survey, the new grossing regime, GROSS 3, has been included.</abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br> Household characteristics (eg. size, tenure type); income and benefit receipt; tenure and housing costs; assets and savings; informal care (given and received); occupation and employment. <br> Standard Measures<br> Standard Occupational Classification<br> <br> The additional derived water and sewerage variables include :<br> a) the water company and sewerage company;<br> b) total annual estimated water consumption in cubic metres;<br> c) estimated water consumption over the summer (taken to be May to August) in cubic metres;<br> d) estimated water consumption over the remainder of the year in cubic metres.</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="1995-04-01T00:00:00Z">April 1995</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="1996-03-01T00:00:00Z">March 1996</collDate>         <nation>Great Britain</nation>         <geogUnit>Standard Statistical Regions</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Families/households</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Families</universe>         <universe>Households</universe>         <universe>Private households in Great Britain south of the Caledonian Canal. <br> Private households in Northern Ireland.</universe>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Repeated cross-sectional study</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>annual - analysed on a financial year basis.</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>Department of Social Security</dataCollector>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <deviat>25000 (target)   26435 (obtained);Multi-purpose grossing factors are available with the dataset. See gross.v32 derived variable specification for details.</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview</collMode>         <sources />         <ConOps>None</ConOps>         <weight>Weighting used. See documentation for details</weight>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage.
